title: Sprint 2: Accountable Growth — Orientation
description: Before setting your Sprint 2 goals, learn what this sprint is about, how it works, and what's expected. Sprint 2 shifts from working alone to working in groups with collaborative accountability.

settings.skipNudgeMessage: This question helps you understand Sprint 2 expectations. Are you sure you want to skip?

questions.prompt: Sprint 2 is called 'Accountable Growth.' In Sprint 1, you developed a skill on your own — the only accountability was yourself. What is the biggest change in Sprint 2?
options: You pick a completely new skill to develop from scratch
You work in a group where collaborative accountability shapes your growth
The assignments are harder but you still work alone
You switch from professional skills to technical skills
questions.hint: Think about what 'accountable' means — who are you accountable to in Sprint 2?
questions.explanation: Sprint 2 puts you in a group. Your group partners' effort affects part of your grade (reflections and check-ins are group-averaged), and you'll need to give and receive honest feedback. The skill you're developing continues from Sprint 1, but now with external accountability.

questions.prompt: Sprint 2 grading has both individual and group-averaged components. Which parts are group-averaged (meaning your group partners' effort affects your grade)?
questions.hint: Goals (20%) and Demo (40%) are individual. What about the other 40%?
questions.explanation: Goals (20%) and Demo (40%) are individual — your own effort. Reflections (20%) and Check-ins (20%) are group-averaged — your partners' participation matters. This means your group's collective engagement directly impacts 40% of your Sprint 2 grade.

questions.prompt: Knowing that 40% of your Sprint 2 grade is group-averaged, what does that mean for how you should approach your group from day one? What will you do to make sure your group succeeds?
questions.placeholder: Think about communication, reliability, and what you'd want from your group partners...

questions.prompt: Sprint 2 runs from Week 5 to Week 8. What is the general weekly rhythm?
options: One big assignment due at the end of each week
A core deliverable (due Fri), a check-in/documentation (due Sun), and a productive reflection (due Tue)
Only in-class activities — nothing due outside of class
questions.hint: Look at the Sprint 2 timeline — deliverables have a consistent pattern across the weeks.
questions.explanation: Each week follows a rhythm: a core deliverable (due Friday), documentation or check-in (due Sunday), and a productive reflection (due Tuesday). This keeps you consistently engaged rather than cramming at the end.

questions.prompt: Match each week with its main focus area:
questions.hint: Sprint 2 builds from goal setting → outreach → challenge → demonstration.
questions.explanation: Sprint 2 follows a deliberate progression: set goals (Week 5), establish external connections and accountability (Week 6), push past comfort zone with a stretch challenge (Week 7), then demonstrate growth with evidence your group can verify (Week 8).

questions.prompt: In Sprint 1, your demo was a handwritten reflection you created yourself. What makes the Sprint 2 demo different?
options: Your group partners validate your demonstrated growth — it's not just your self-assessment
You present to the whole class instead of a partner
There is no demo in Sprint 2
questions.hint: The sprint is called 'Accountable Growth' — how does accountability show up in the demo?
questions.explanation: Sprint 2's demo is 'Demonstration with Validation.' Your growth claims need to be verified by your group partners, not just self-reported. This is the accountability element — external assessment alongside self-assessment.

questions.prompt: What excites you most about Sprint 2? What concerns you? Be honest — this reflection is for you.
questions.placeholder: Consider: working with others, being held accountable, the stretch challenge, group-averaged grades...
